channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Aukus pact: France and US seek to mend rift
item.description: The deal caused outrage in France, which lost a contract to build submarines for Australia.

item.title: President Biden pledges 500m more vaccine doses to developing world
item.description: The US president promises an extra 500 million shots to the developing world, as he hosts a Covid summit.

item.title: Angry scenes at Haiti airport as deported migrants arrive
item.description: The US is flying migrants out of a Texas border town where 13,000 have gathered in makeshift camps.

item.title: La Palma volcano lava engulfs homes and swimming pools
item.description: Molten rock from the erupting Cumbre Vieja volcano is destroying hundreds of buildings.

item.title: Trump sues niece and New York Times over tax story
item.description: A lawsuit accuses Mary Trump and reporters of an "insidious plot" to obtain confidential documents.

item.title: Cavers descend into Yemen's 'Well of Hell' for first time
item.description: The 112m-deep pit has long been shunned by many local people, who believe it harbours genies.

item.title: Air pollution: Even worse than we thought - WHO
item.description: The WHO is slashing recommended maximum limits of key pollutants as evidence of danger mounts.

item.title: 'Side-eying Chloe' Clem to sell iconic meme as NFT
item.description: The image of Chloe Clem could fetch her tens of thousands of dollars at auction.

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Crew member's Covid case triggers lockdown
item.description: A crew member on I'm a Celebrity tests positive, sending thousands into lockdown and sparking a backlash.

item.title: Lithuania urges people to throw away Chinese phones
item.description: The country's National Cyber Security Centre found security risks in both Xiaomi and Huawei models.

item.title: German cashier shooting linked to Covid-19 conspiracies
item.description: A man suspected of killing a cashier is linked to conspiracy theorists and far-right politics.

item.title: Willie Garson: Sex and the City actors remember late co-star
item.description: The actor, who has died aged 57, was known for his role as Stanford Blatch in the series and films.

item.title: Why China's Xi Jinping looks to be pursuing a road back to socialism
item.description: China has not been very socialist for years, but the Communist Party looks set to change that.

item.title: Bolsonaro: Fact-checking claims by the Brazilian leader at UN
item.description: Mr Bolsonaro's speech to the UN had a number of claims in it, which we've looked into.

item.title: Are 241 million vaccine doses at risk of going to waste?
item.description: Joe Biden wants more global vaccine equality but the US and other nations have not backed promises with action.

item.title: Aukus: Australia's big gamble on the US over China
item.description: Australia has taken a central role in the Aukus defence pact - there are major benefits and risks too.

item.title: World War Two: The brothers who fled Nazi occupation by kayak
item.description: The "Engelandvaarders" who paddled from the Netherlands to England 80 years ago.

item.title: COP 26: How much is the developing world getting to fight climate change?
item.description: Are rich countries living up to their climate promises to the developing world?

item.title: Melbourne earthquake: Australians react to rare quake that rattled country
item.description: One resident thought the 5.9 magnitude quake was just his neighbours doing an intense workout.

item.title: Life at 50C: Heat hitting home in Australia
item.description: Cities like Sydney are already experiencing extremely hot days because of climate change.

item.title: Melbourne protests: Third day of violent anti-vaccine demonstrations
item.description: Demonstrators have been marching against lockdowns and mandatory vaccines in Australia's second largest city.

item.title: BTS: Korean boyband open UN general debate with performance and speech
item.description: The UN general debate opened with K-pop band BTS, followed by a speech about sustainable development.

item.title: Imran Khan: Afghan women 'are very strong'
item.description: Pakistan's prime minster suggests that, in time, women can "assert their rights" under the Taliban.
